channel.title: Help!
channel.description:
'Java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
help plz i reinstled java 3 times help plz

item.title: Help!
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

Google your error, and if you can’t find a fix, then try using ‘Paint’ in your spare time rather than programming.

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Jc-Scape-Pk Jc-Scape-Pk
item.description:
@Jc-Scape-Pk wrote:

[quote=“klomp3, post:4, topic:287158”]you don’t need jre, follow this steps:

  1. Go to “My Documents”
  2. Click on “View system information”
  3. Click on “Advanced”
  4. Then click on “Environment Variables”
  5. Then click on “New” and add as name: CLASSPATH and as value: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java[b]jdk1.6.0_14[/b]\bin;%CLASSPATH%; (the jdk1.6.0_14 is the version of java you got, if you got version 13 u need to make it jdk1.6.0_13).
  6. then make another new one named: PATH and as value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin (jave is same as the classpath)
  7. Then, keep pressing OK and you’re done, unless you’re compiler or runserver is still standing on the wrong java, change it also to the version you have.

-Klomp3[/quote] not work

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @klomp3 klomp3
item.description:
@klomp3 wrote:

you don’t need jre, follow this steps:

  1. Go to “My Documents”
  2. Click on “View system information”
  3. Click on “Advanced”
  4. Then click on “Environment Variables”
  5. Then click on “New” and add as name: CLASSPATH and as value: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java[b]jdk1.6.0_14[/b]\bin;%CLASSPATH%; (the jdk1.6.0_14 is the version of java you got, if you got version 13 u need to make it jdk1.6.0_13).
  6. then make another new one named: PATH and as value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin (jave is same as the classpath)
  7. Then, keep pressing OK and you’re done, unless you’re compiler or runserver is still standing on the wrong java, change it also to the version you have.

-Klomp3

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Jc-Scape-Pk Jc-Scape-Pk
item.description:
@Jc-Scape-Pk wrote:

[quote=“wtfry, post:1, topic:287165”]you downloaded jdk version 6 update 14 and jre version 6 update 14 right?[/quote]Not jre

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Jc-Scape-Pk Jc-Scape-Pk
item.description:
@Jc-Scape-Pk wrote:

[quote=“wtfry, post:1, topic:287160”]Your enviromental variables are not set correct.
You will need to change them by going to “My Computer” or “Computer” then go to “System Properties” and click “Advanced System Settings”
Then It should open a little interface and then you need to click “Enviromental Variables” Under the System Variabls Find “CLASSPATH” and click on it once then click edit. Change the Variable Value to Program Files\Java\jre6\lib\ext\QTJava.zip
Then click “Ok” and still under System Variables look for “PATH” and click it once then click the edit button and change the variable value to C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;C:\Program Files\Common Files\Roxio Shared\DLLShared\;C:\Program Files\QuickTime\QTSystem\ then click ok and ok again ok again, and you should be fine.[/quote]Nop not work

Read full topic
